intro: Teloxys vagans, commonly known as the wandering teloxys, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has slender, branching stems. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Teloxys vagans produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
